intro: Polygala caracasana, commonly known as the Caracas Polygala, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that splits open to release its seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
